https://www.nytimes.com/2015/12/01/opini.snippet: Governments have legitimate reasons to seek user data beyond their territorial reach, and privacy advocates ignore that need at their peril.
https://www.nytimes.com/2015/12/01/opini.abstract: Op-Ed article by Andrew Keane Woods observes that countries around world are increasingly exercising territorial control over Internet and Internet users' data, largely due to concerns about fact that much of Internet data is controlled by United States companies; underscores need for some kind of international agreement to govern Internet surveillance, and, in meantime, urges US companies to make it easier for foreign law enforcement agencies to access data.

https://www.nytimes.com/2015/12/02/nyreg.snippet: Dozens of organizations that provide social services in New York and the surrounding area are undertaking rebranding efforts to freshen their appeal and ensure that the public knows what they do.
https://www.nytimes.com/2015/12/02/nyreg.abstract: Dozens of nonprofit groups in New York City and surrounding metropolitan area are trying to find new names and rebrand themselves in order to better reflect their missions; LiveOn NY is example of one of those groups, as it shed its previous name Council of Senior Centers and Services of New York City Inc, which it has had since its founding, in July.

headline.main: Nonprofits, Aiming for Relevance, Try On New Names

https://www.nytimes.com/2015/12/02/us/re.snippet: Archaeological sites that have rested in peace beneath the water for hundreds of years have become visible during the state’s drought leaving them susceptible to looters.

https://www.nytimes.com/2015/12/01/techn.snippet: Corporate executives and government officials flocked to the EkoParty conference in Buenos Aires in search of the world’s most creative hackers.
https://www.nytimes.com/2015/12/01/techn.abstract: Corporations and foreign nations are looking to Argentina to recruit tech hackers to aid in defense against online criminals and state-sponsored spies; governments are anxious to procure hackers' tools; EkoParty, annual Latin America hacking conference, has emerged as reliable source.

headline.main: In a Global Market for Hacking Talent, Argentines Stand Out
headline.print_headline: Famed for Tango and Hackers

https://www.nytimes.com/2015/12/01/movie.snippet: Mr. Navarro, the Jane’s Addiction guitarist, appears in a very personal documentary, directed by Todd Newman.
https://www.nytimes.com/2015/12/01/movie.abstract: Guitarist Dave Navarro collaborates on documentary Mourning Son, which explores impact of his mother’s 1983 murder when he was age 15; film, directed by Todd Newman, includes Navarro’s interview in San Quentin State Prison with John Riccardi, his mother's ex-boyfriend who was convicted of murdering her and her friend, Sue Jory, in 1994.

headline.main: Dave Navarro’s ‘Mourning Son’ Tells the Story of His Mother’s Murder
headline.print_headline: Facing His Mother’s Killer
